title: The Times view on Starmer’s praise for Thatcher: Iron Chatter

title: Starmer: Labour must be obsessed with growth to turn economy around

title: British workers missing out on £10,700 a year as living standards fall

title: Labour more trusted than Tories to grow the economy

title: War crime is the rule, not the exception – weekly briefing

title: 'Labour won't turn on spending taps' says Starmer
description: Sir Keir Starmer is to warn that the UK will face "huge constraints" on public spending if his party win the next General Election. On Monday, he will say anyone expecting an incoming Labour government "to quickly turn on the spending taps is going to be disappointed".

title: Keir Starmer: Labour ‘won’t turn on spending taps’ if it wins election

title: Sunak and Starmer refuse to commit to pensions triple lock beyond election
description: Rishi Sunak and Sir Keir Starmer have both refused to commit to maintaining the pensions triple lock beyond the next election, amid growing scepticism over the long-term sustainability of the policy. The Prime Minister stressed that his Government has ...

title: Starmer can kick BBC licence fee political football into touch
description: removing the big stick Downing Street wields over the corporation. Whether Sir Keir Starmer is willing to give up that influence over the national broadcaster is another matter.

title: State pension triple lock in doubt as Sunak and Starmer won’t commit to it
description: Sir Keir Starmer, who has also been attending the summit in Dubai, said: “This Government made the commitment on the triple lock and it’s for this Government to keep to its commitment. “We will set out our position as we get to the election.

title: Keir Starmer Faces Left-Wing Backlash After Praising Margaret Thatcher
description: The Labour leader said the former prime minister had "sought to drag Britain out of its stupor" as he made a pitch for Tory voters.

title: Sir Keir Starmer criticised for crediting Margaret Thatcher’s ‘sense of purpose’
description: Sir Keir Starmer was accused of trying to “ride on the coattails” of Margaret Thatcher’s success by praising the former prime minister while appealing to Tory voters.

title: Keir Starmer caught in Labour backlash after praising Margaret Thatcher

title: 'Labour won't turn on spending taps' says Starmer
description: Sir Keir Starmer is to warn that the UK will face "huge constraints" on public spending if his party win the next General Election. On Monday, he will say anyone expecting an incoming Labour government "to quickly turn on the spending taps is going to be disappointed".

title: Labour won't turn on spending taps if it wins UK election, Starmer says
description: A Labour government would not "turn on the spending taps" but will focus obsessively on growth because British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Conservatives have wrecked public finances, the party's leader Keir Starmer will say on Monday.

title: Sunak and Starmer refuse to commit to pensions triple lock beyond election

title: Former Labour minister and MEP Baroness Kinnock dies
